titleInfo.title: Letter from the Political Department, Bombay to Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident at Bushire

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The letter has suffered from insect damage which has obscured numerous words throughout the letter and its enclosures.

mods.abstract: The letter is requesting that the Resident obtain reparation for the owner of the Narrain Pupaud, captured by Joasemee [QawƒÅsim] pirates.Enclosed is a letter from Charles William Elwood, Agent to the Government, to Francis Warden, dated 14 August [? 1816], requesting assistance to release Hurres Kussun and Pukeer Ny-eeo, Banyans, who are held hostage by Joasemee pirates and cannot afford to pay their ransom.This letter in turn encloses a translation of a statement by Vesee Ram Bhuggut, a 'vagrant' of Porebundar [Porbandar], dated 14 August 1816, describing an attack by Joasemee pirates on the boat Narrain Pupaudnear Muscat which he was travelling on at the time.Also enclosed is a letter from Charles William Elwood to Francis Warden, dated 12 October 1816, explaining when a British pass was issued to the Narrain Pupaud.
